required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women and Optimization of Prenatal Care Services
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women in Zinder, Niger and Optimization of Prenatal Care Services

brief_summary.textblock: A national survey in Niger found that women and children are at risk of undernutrition and that many pregnant women don't visit health centers during pregnancy as often as is recommended. The aim is to assess the nutritional and health status of pregnant women in the Zinder region and to understand their knowledge, attitudes and practices related to health and nutrition during pregnancy. In collaboration with the Medical District of Zinder the prenatal care services will be optimized and the programmatic impact on gestational weight gain and anemia prevalence will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of inadequate gestational weight gain
Access and adherence to prenatal iron and folic acid supplements

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of inadequate dietary diversity scores

arm_group.description: The baseline survey will be implemented among pregnant women in randomly selected villages using a continuous enrollment schedule over the period of 18 months

The programmatic impact of optimized prenatal care services on women's health and behavior will be assessed among pregnant women in randomly selected villages (Programmatic prenatal care optimization)

intervention.description: To further integrate and improve nutrition-related services and messages in the prenatal care package.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood and urine sample for assessment of nutritional status

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women residing in participating villages

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women, who have severe illness warranting immediate hospital referral
